conclusion: To determine if the two objects have the same acceleration at time t1, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided.
The graph shows the velocity v as a function of time t for two objects, A and B.
The slope of the velocity-time graph gives the acceleration. Specifically, the acceleration a is given by the derivative of velocity with respect to time, a = dv/dt.
At time t1, we need to find the slopes of the velocity-time graphs for objects A and B.

The slope of the graph for object A at t1 is the tangent of the angle that the line makes with the time-axis. From the graph, we can see that the slope of the line for object A is negative and decreasing.

The slope of the graph for object B at t1 is the tangent of the angle that the line makes with the time-axis. From the graph, we can see that the slope of the line for object B is also negative and decreasing.
Since both objects have negative slopes and the slopes appear to be the same at t1, we can conclude that the accelerations of the two objects are the same at t1.
The acceleration is the slope of the velocity-time graph. Since the slopes of the graphs for objects A and B at t1 are the same, the accelerations of the two objects are the same at t1.
